title: Innovative Teaching Method Design for Improving Statistics Education Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical concepts and practical experience in social sector roles
context.additional_context: Course for in-service elementary educators to improve statistical literacy, offering flexible learning environments centered on personal device usage and formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can reduce statistical anxiety by over 30% and improve exam performance and class participation.

Learners set three personal standards (PS) according to the SMART principles (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound), establish and execute a 12-week weekly learning plan (time/content/evaluation criteria), and achieve an 80%+ implementation rate at the 8-week midterm review.
Learners can acquire at least five statistical analysis techniques applicable to real educational settings.
Learners can achieve an 80% or higher proficiency standard in formative assessments through peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
